snippet: The global regulator of doping in sports answered a Senate committee’s inquiry this week, seeking to assure lawmakers that taxpayer money was well spent....
abstract: World Anti-Doping Agency, following questions about why it did not respond more aggressively to whistle-blowers' claims of government-run doping program in Russia, tells United States lawmakers that it did not have authority to investigate such accusations.
lead_paragraph: The global regulator of doping in sports answered a Senate committee’s inquiry this week, seeking to assure lawmakers that taxpayer money was well spent.

headline.main: Doping Watchdog Answers Questions From United States Senate
headline.print_headline: WADA Tells Lawmakers It Lacked ‘Clear Authority’ to Investigate Russian Sports
